summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Thirteenth Avenue South from Dearborn Street to Norman Street, in the City of Seattle, by constructing sewers, side sewers and water mains of proper dimensions and materials, together with all wyes, gates, tees, crosses and all other appurtenances necessary for the proper drainage and water service of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 1887 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
